li.a: Notice Regarding School Board Meetings- COVID-19
NCPS Elementary Schools' Parent and Family Policy

div.data-react-data-bundle: {"notifications":[{"id":7949,"message":"All Pre-K, K and 7th-grade students need to turn in an updated shot record. All first time Pre-K and K students also need to turn in a wellness physical form. Lastly, any student grade 6th-12th who would like to try out for sports at any time during the school year must turn in a VHSL sports physical form dated after 5\/1\/2020","type":"banner"},{"id":8078,"message":"Northampton County Schools will be temporarily suspending our food program. We are planning to restart our program in the near future. In the meantime, several organizations are partnering to fill the void. On Monday, April 27th, First Baptist Church of Capeville will be serving students a hot meal at the church for pickup from 12:45 p.m. -2:00 p.m. On Tuesday, the Eastern Shore Foodbank will be partnering with the \u201cShore Delivery Corps\u201d and the Northampton County Education Foundation to distribute food from our high school campus from 10:00-12:00. All families are asked to pick-up their food from the high school site. Beginning Thursday, April 30th, the Northampton County Food Task Force will be distributing food at all of our campuses from 10:00-12:00 p.m. I want to thank these organizations for assisting Northampton County Schools with providing meals for our students. Instructional learning packets will still be available for pick-up at all school locations on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 10 -12. Please be safe.","type":"overlay"}]}

div.div:
Expand
At-Home Learning Resources
Expand
NCPS School Board Special Called Work Session
The School Board will have a special called Work Session at 3pm on Monday, April 27th. This meeting is necessary to discuss changes to the School Board's FY 21 Budget Proposal that are necessary due to the financial and operational impact of COVID on our school division. Audio of the meeting will be made available to the public using the same procedure used for recent Board Meetings.

div.p: As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click read more to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. Youll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
